image_analysis.purpose: AI training dataset for Sweet Robo manual assistant

images.description: Machine user interface view showing how the Robo Ice Cream machine looks from a customer's perspective. Best used for title page or cover.
images.ai_training_notes: Shows machine UI from customer viewpoint. Ideal for manual cover/title page only.

images.description: External components diagram with clear labels for LED signage, touch screen, viewing window, coin acceptor, bill acceptor, credit card reader, and collection door
images.ai_training_notes: Excellent for teaching component identification, perfect labeling example
images.text_content: LED Signage, Touch Screen, Viewing Window, Coin Acceptor, Bill Acceptor, Credit Card Reader, Collection Door

images.description: Internal view showing F2's dual ice cream hoppers, timer, breaker, power switches, cup holder/dispenser, syrup holders, topping dispensers, UV sanitizer, and Blue Robo delivery bot with detailed labels
images.ai_training_notes: Critical for F2 identification - shows dual hopper system that distinguishes F2 from F1. Excellent for technical training.
images.text_content: Timer, Breaker/Power SW, Main IO Power SW, Cup Holder/Dispenser, Ice Cream Hoppers, Syrup Holders, Topping Holders, Topping Dispenser, UV Sanitizer, Syrup Dispenser, Ice Cream Dispenser, Blue Robo - Delivery Bot

images.description: Three orange ice cream serving cups with Sweet Robo branding and cute character designs. Each cup has a spoon attached at the bottom for customer convenience.
images.ai_training_notes: CORRECTED - Moved from setup to operation section. Shows consumable serving cups with integrated spoons attached at the bottom, used during ice cream service.
images.processing_notes: Successfully relocated from setup to operation folder

images.description: Maintenance and preparation supplies including blue bottle brush for cleaning, wire whisk for ice cream mix preparation, and blue cleaning cloths.
images.ai_training_notes: CORRECTED - Moved from setup to maintenance section. Shows both cleaning tools (brush, cloths) and mix preparation tools (whisk for making ice cream, not for cleaning).
images.processing_notes: Successfully relocated from setup to maintenance folder

images.description: 10-liter transparent measuring bucket with graduated markings (2L to 10L) used for mixing ice cream preparations.
images.ai_training_notes: CORRECTED - Moved from setup to maintenance section. Shows mixing bucket for ice cream preparation.
images.processing_notes: Successfully relocated from setup to maintenance folder

images.description: Screen showing where to touch (yellow circle in top right) to access backend operator settings.
images.ai_training_notes: Shows yellow circle indicator in top right corner where operators need to touch to access backend settings.
images.processing_notes: Correctly identified as backend access instruction, not branding

images.description: Sweet Robo company logo featuring a robotic arm and colorful text 'SWEET ROBO - TASTE THE FUTURE'
images.ai_training_notes: Main company logo used throughout documentation and branding materials.

images.description: Example photo showing tools needed for mix preparation: powder, mixer, and bucket
images.ai_training_notes: Placeholder image showing mix preparation tools. May not be used in final manual - better step-by-step image needed.
images.processing_notes: Placeholder image - shows what's needed but not ideal for step-by-step instructions

images.description: View of ice cream hopper after being filled with prepared mix
images.ai_training_notes: Shows how the hopper looks after ice cream mix has been added - useful for verifying proper fill level.

images.description: Using electric mixer to blend ice cream powder and water after initial mixing
images.ai_training_notes: Shows electric mixer being used to thoroughly blend ice cream mix after powder and water are combined.

images.description: Device settings screen in the operator backend interface
images.ai_training_notes: Shows device configuration options in backend system.

images.description: Main management interface screen for operators
images.ai_training_notes: Primary operator interface for managing the ice cream machine.

images.description: Password input screen for accessing backend operator settings
images.ai_training_notes: Security screen requiring password to access backend functions.

images.description: Cup dispenser installation instructions during machine setup
images.ai_training_notes: Shows proper installation of cup dispenser component.

images.description: Machine wheel with locking mechanism to secure the unit in place
images.ai_training_notes: Shows the wheel locking mechanism used to prevent machine movement once positioned.

images.description: Ice cream hopper setup instructions for the F2 dual hopper system
images.ai_training_notes: Critical for F2 model - shows dual hopper setup process.

images.description: LED signage roof component showing illuminated 'Robo ice cream' text in pink/purple neon style
images.ai_training_notes: Top roof component with LED lighting that displays machine branding. Important for machine identification and customer attraction.

images.description: QR code for accessing the digital manual online
images.ai_training_notes: QR code specifically for accessing the online manual.

images.description: Digital clamp multimeter model MT87 with test leads and batteries. Used for electrical diagnostics and amperage measurements during troubleshooting.
images.ai_training_notes: Essential diagnostic tool for checking electrical systems. Can measure up to 600V and various amperage ranges.
images.text_content: MT87, DATA HOLD, 20A, 200A, 400A, 450V, 600V, COM, V Ω

images.description: Installation tool kit including Phillips screwdriver, hex key/allen wrench, spare sensor component, and Sweet Robo branded tool bag. Additional items like screws and power sensor mentioned but not pictured.
images.ai_training_notes: Complete installation toolkit provided with machine. Shows essential tools needed for setup and basic maintenance.

images.description: Close-up view of airpath adjustment component showing notches with default position at second notch. Controls air flow in hopper system.
images.ai_training_notes: Important for proper air flow adjustment. Default setting is at second notch position.

images.description: Airpath component installed in hopper with ice cream mix visible. Shows proper installation position within stainless steel hopper.
images.ai_training_notes: Shows airpath in operational position with mix present. Useful for verifying correct installation.

images.description: Top view of airpath component showing critical air intake opening that must not be covered. Essential for proper hopper operation.
images.ai_training_notes: Critical safety/operation note: Top opening must remain uncovered for proper air flow. Important maintenance instruction.

images.description: Approved Hershey's chocolate syrup in 7 lb 8 oz (3.4 kg) container. Genuine chocolate flavor topping for ice cream. Includes syrup pump offer.
images.ai_training_notes: Shows approved brand and size of chocolate syrup. Important for ordering correct supplies.
images.text_content: HERSHEY'S SYRUP, GENUINE CHOCOLATE FLAVOR, 45 CALORIES, NET WT 7 LB 8 OZ (3.4 kg), SYRUP PUMP OFFER

images.description: Ice cream powder mix in foil package labeled 'NS GELATO PREMIUM'. Used for preparing ice cream base when mixed with water.
images.ai_training_notes: Essential consumable supply. Shows typical packaging for ice cream powder mix. Hershey's syrup visible in background.

images.description: Dispenser seal kit components shown from angle 2 - includes clear plastic housing with white shaft, orange O-ring seals, and white gasket components.
images.ai_training_notes: Alternative angle of dispenser seal kit showing assembly details. Important for understanding component orientation.

images.description: Dispenser seal kit top view showing clear housing assembly, white shaft with orange O-rings, and white gasket/seal components for ice cream dispenser maintenance.
images.ai_training_notes: Complete seal kit for dispenser maintenance. Shows all components needed for seal replacement.

images.description: Comprehensive spare parts kit including food-grade MP grease (BX-121/2, NSF approved), various O-rings and gaskets, tubing, cleaning brush, red coupling tool, and technical component diagram/manual.
images.ai_training_notes: Complete maintenance kit with food-safe lubricant and common replacement parts. Manual shows electrical/component diagram.
images.text_content: FOOD GRADE, RSFG-02, MP Grease, BX-121/2, NSF, GP300T series labels

images.description: Agitator shaft cleaning kit featuring blue spiral bristle brush and white plastic agitator component. Essential for proper cleaning of ice cream mixing shaft.
images.ai_training_notes: Specialized cleaning brush designed specifically for agitator shaft maintenance. Blue bristles in spiral pattern for thorough cleaning.

images.description: Set of three black long-handled spoons with decorative spiral handles and slotted bowls. Used for dispensing syrups and toppings onto ice cream.
images.ai_training_notes: Specialized spoons for syrup and topping service. Long handles prevent contamination, slotted design allows drainage.

analysis_summary.file_size_reduction_potential: Completed - all images converted to WebP
analysis_summary.processing_update: 2025-07-30 - Added 12 new images from to_sort folder. All converted to WebP and organized into appropriate sections.
renamed_files: Multiple files from to_sort renamed descriptively
analysis_summary.notes: mix-preparation-step-1.webp is a placeholder showing tools but may not be used in final manual

key_learning_points: F2 has dual hoppers vs F1 single hopper - critical distinguishing feature
External component diagrams are excellent for component identification training
Image placement accuracy is crucial for manual usability
Sweet Robo uses consistent orange/purple branding
Cleaning supplies and consumables are often confused with setup materials
common_misidentification_risks: Cleaning supplies mistaken for installation tools
Marketing graphics vs technical diagrams distinction needed
